title: Everyday English Course 53
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: It's too close to the supermarket.
It's too high in case of a fire.
It was damaged in a fire.
instances.correctAnswer: It's too high in case of a fire.

variables.a: What does Lisa not like about her new apartment?
Who will get the stamps at last?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: You know. I called you several times last week, but nobody answered the phone.
M: Well, I was in Sydney at that time.
W: Did you go there on business?
M: No, I visited my aunt and her family.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: You know. I called you several times last week, but nobody answered the phone.
M: Well, I was in Sydney at that time.
W: Did you go there on business?
M: No, I visited my aunt and her family.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: You know. I called you several times last week, but nobody answered the phone.
M: Well, I was in Sydney at that time.
W: Did you go there on business?
M: No, I visited my aunt and her family.
{a}

answerOptions: The man was with his aunt and her family last week.
The man took a business trip to Sydney last week.
The man and his aunt went to Sydney last week.
instances.correctAnswer: The man was with his aunt and her family last week.

variables.a: What can we learn from the conversation?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Excuse me, could you tell me where the International Post Office is?
W: Go straight on; turn right at the first traffic lights. The post office is about fifty meters away.
M: I see. And is the No.13 Middle School far away from the post office?
W: Not at all. It's about 150 meters. Where do you want to go?
M: Oh, I only want to pick up my cousin from school. I am told that the school is next to the post office, and that is why I want to know how to get to the post office first.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

{a}

variables.a: Where does the man want to go at last?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: That is a beautiful painting, Jerry! Where did you buy it?
M: Actually, I made it. I've been taking art classes for the past year.
W: Really? That's amazing! I had no idea you were so talented. This looks like it was painted by a professional.
{a}

M: Actually, I made it. I've been taking art classes for the past year.

{a}

variables.a: How does the woman feel about the man's painting?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: I've been thinking of changing my job.
M: Do you think you'll leave the airline soon? It is really a well-paid job, isn't it?
W: Yes, but I'm getting tired of being constantly on the move. I just want to settle down.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: I've been thinking of changing my job.
M: Do you think you'll leave the airline soon? It is really a well-paid job, isn't it?
W: Yes, but I'm getting tired of being constantly on the move. I just want to settle down.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: I've been thinking of changing my job.
M: Do you think you'll leave the airline soon? It is really a well-paid job, isn't it?
W: Yes, but I'm getting tired of being constantly on the move. I just want to settle down.
{a}

answerOptions: Because she likes to travel around
Because she hates to be always flying
Because she has found a better-paid job
instances.correctAnswer: Because she hates to be always flying

variables.a: Why does the woman want to change her job?

answerOptions: No. The shop doesn't have caps.
instances.correctAnswer: No. The shop doesn't have caps.

variables.a: Can the man buy a cap?
When could the woman visit the man?
What will the woman do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Excuse me. Do you have time to help take a picture of us?
W: Oh, I'm sorry. I've got to catch a bus.
M: That's OK.
{a}

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: He gets up late every day.

variables.a: What do we know about the man?

answerOptions: He has got a heart attack.

variables.a: What do we know about the man?
How often does the man go to cinema?

answerOptions: She is reading about Bill Gates.
She wants to be more efficient.
She just came up with the idea herself.
instances.correctAnswer: She wants to be more efficient.

variables.a: Why is the woman using two computers?

answerOptions: He doesn't care what George said.
instances.correctAnswer: He doesn't care what George said.

variables.a: What do you think happened?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: The summer holiday is coming soon. Where are you going for your holiday?
W: I'm going to Beijing. How about you?
M: I haven't decided yet. But probably I'll find a part-time job to earn some money.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: The summer holiday is coming soon. Where are you going for your holiday?
W: I'm going to Beijing. How about you?
M: I haven't decided yet. But probably I'll find a part-time job to earn some money.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: The summer holiday is coming soon. Where are you going for your holiday?
W: I'm going to Beijing. How about you?
M: I haven't decided yet. But probably I'll find a part-time job to earn some money.
{a}

answerOptions: A visit to Beijing during the summer holiday.
Finding a part-time job during the summer holiday.
A plan for the coming summer holiday.
instances.correctAnswer: A plan for the coming summer holiday.

variables.a: What are they talking about?
What are the two speakers talking about?

answerOptions: He thinks that there won't be enough sets for everybody.
He thinks that there might not be any more tickets available.
He thinks the seminar won't be open to the public.
instances.correctAnswer: He thinks that there might not be any more tickets available.

variables.a: Why is the man afraid he won't be able to attend the seminar?
What did the woman think?

answerOptions: He has nothing to say about it.

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where is Jane now?
Who are talking?

answerOptions: He will take out the books.
He will help the woman with the box.

variables.a: What will the man do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: If I were you, I'd take the bus to work. Driving in that rush hour traffic is terrible.
M: But, you know, by the time the bus gets to my stop, there aren't any seats left.
W: Oh, I got it.
{a}

instances.correctAnswer: The woman should choose the right foods.

variables.a: What did the man do last year for his brother's birthday?

answerOptions: She drove her taxi into a car park.
She parked her car in a taxi park.
She waited in a taxi for too long.
